div.aria-label: COVID-19 Update as of 4/15/2020 News Post
div.p: The CSAL, Inc. System remains committed to the safety and wellbeing of its students, employees and visitors. In light of current concerns of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and concerns about exposure in Louisiana, our campuses remain closed. However, each school has individual educational plans designed for its students. See more details below..
div.span:
CSAL, Inc. detail plans in response to Coronavirus concerns:
The CSAL, Inc. System remains committed to the safety and wellbeing of its students, employees and visitors. In light of current concerns of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and concerns about exposure in Louisiana, our campuses remain closed. However, each school has individual educational plans designed for its students.
The continuation plan for each school is listed below, however, the 2020-2021 school year application process is still open.
**APPLICATIONS FOR ALL CSAL, INC. SCHOOLS ARE BEING ACCEPTED. You may download each application from this website or directly from each school’s site. They may be returned by mail to 4962 Florida Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70806 or dropped off to the District Administration Office drop box at the front door.
LA VIRTUAL CHARTER ACADEMY
*School’s Website -http:Lavca.k12.com
La. Virtual has continued to provide instruction without interruption. Teachers will continue to direct students and families based on supported instruction from school leadership. We acknowledge that LA Virtual Charter was designed to engage students with fulltime virtual learning, so amid the coronavirus pandemic, students at Louisiana Virtual Charter Academy are already familiar with this platform and can continue to have success and growth in their educational careers. We applaud out staff, students and their families for continuing the learning process
MADISON PREPARATORY ACADEMY
*School’s Website – http:Mpa.csalcharterschools.org
Informational letters have been mailed to each student’s home. This letter will give students the option to opt in or out of classwork for the remaining semester. Beginning Monday, April 13th through June 12th students can complete classwork for enrichment and grade improvement, while continuing the learning process. Please be informed that no student will receive a grade lower than what has been earned as of the last day of school, based on the Governor’s mandate. (March 13, 2020)
The Option survey letters should be dropped off to our District Administrative Offices at 4962 Florida Blvd. There is a drop window by the front door. Should you have any questions please contact Mrs. Welsh, Principal by email – awelsh@madisonpreponline.org
CSAL MIDDLE SCHOOL
*School Website – http:Mcs.csalcharterschools.org
Enrichment assignments have been posted for our students in Google Classroom. Our expectation is that students do their very best to complete each assignment. By completing the assignments students will continue the learning process. Students who may be/were currently failing, as of the March 13th close-out date will be allowed to increase those grades and will be directed further on this venture by the instructor of those specific classes. Should you have any questions please contact Mr. Franklin, Principal by email – dfranklin@csalmiddle.org
CSAL ELEMENTARY
*School Website – http:Ces.csalcharterschools.org
2020-2021 School year applications are still being accepted for grades K-2. Should you have any questions please contact Ms. Mathis, Principal, by email – amathis@csalonline.org
All CSAL, Inc. students, employees, and parents are encouraged to rely upon relevant information disseminated via this website, www.csalcharterschools.org, school social media, text messages and emails. As always, refer to coronavirus.gov for social distancing travel advisories, safety tips and more pertinent information as this is an ever-evolving situation.
